dict.string: Fast emoji search using Almoji CLI

#!/bin/bash
# Function to output error JSON error_json() { local title="$1" local subtitle="$2" echo "{\"items\": [{\"title\": \"$title\", \"subtitle\": \"$subtitle\", \"valid\": false}]}" }
# Find almoji binary almoji_bin="" if command -v almoji &>/dev/null; then almoji_bin="almoji" elif [ -x "$HOME/.local/bin/almoji" ]; then almoji_bin="$HOME/.local/bin/almoji" elif [ -x "$HOME/.cargo/bin/almoji" ]; then almoji_bin="$HOME/.cargo/bin/almoji" elif [ -x "/usr/local/bin/almoji" ]; then almoji_bin="/usr/local/bin/almoji" else error_json "Almoji not found" "Install with: cargo install --path /path/to/almoji" exit 0 fi
# Get the query from Alfred query="$1"
# Get configuration variables (with defaults) skin_tone="${skin_tone:-}" gender="${gender:-}"
# Build the almoji command arguments args="--limit 20"
# Add skin tone if set if [ -n "$skin_tone" ]; then args="$args --skin-tone $skin_tone" fi
# Add gender if set if [ -n "$gender" ]; then args="$args --gender $gender" fi
# Add query if [ -n "$query" ]; then args="$args $query" fi
# Execute almoji and capture both stdout and stderr temp_err=$(mktemp) emoji_results=$("$almoji_bin" $args 2>"$temp_err") exit_code=$? error_output=$(cat "$temp_err") rm -f "$temp_err"
# Check if command failed if [ $exit_code -ne 0 ]; then if [ -n "$error_output" ]; then error_json "Almoji error" "$error_output" else error_json "Almoji failed" "Exit code: $exit_code" fi exit 0 fi
# Check if we got results if [ -z "$emoji_results" ]; then error_json "No emojis found" "Try a different search term" exit 0 fi
# Start building JSON output echo -n '{"items": ['
first=true # Store regex in variable to avoid bash parsing issues regex='^(.+)[[:space:]]\(([^)]+)\)$'
while IFS= read -r line; do # Parse the emoji and keyword from output like "ðŸ”¥ (fire)" if [[ $line =~ $regex ]]; then emoji="${BASH_REMATCH[1]}" keyword="${BASH_REMATCH[2]}"
# Add comma separator for all but first item if [ "$first" = true ]; then first=false else echo -n ',' fi
# Build JSON item cat <<EOF { "uid": "$keyword", "title": "$emoji", "subtitle": "$keyword", "arg": "$emoji", "text": { "copy": "$emoji", "largetype": "$emoji" }, "valid": true } EOF fi done <<< "$emoji_results"
echo -n ']}'

#!/bin/bash
# Get the emoji from the query emoji="$1"
# Save the current clipboard content original_clipboard=$(pbpaste)
# Copy the emoji to clipboard echo -n "$emoji" | pbcopy
# Paste the emoji into the frontmost application osascript -e 'tell application "System Events" to keystroke "v" using command down'
# Wait a brief moment for the paste to complete sleep 0.2
# Restore the original clipboard content echo -n "$original_clipboard" | pbcopy

Almoji Alfred Workflow
Search for emojis quickly using the Almoji CLI.
Usage: - Type '; <search term>' to search for emojis - Press Enter to paste the emoji into the frontmost application - Your clipboard content is automatically preserved and restored
Configuration: - skin_tone: Set default skin tone (light, medium-light, medium, medium-dark, dark) - gender: Set default gender variant (male, female, neutral)
Installation: 1. Install almoji: cargo install --path /path/to/almoji 2. Import this workflow into Alfred 3. Type '; fire' to search for fire emojis
The workflow will automatically find almoji if it's in: - Your PATH - ~/.cargo/bin/almoji - /usr/local/bin/almoji
Default skin tone for emojis that support it
